info.title: Microsoft Dataverse
info.description: Provides access to the org-based database on Microsoft Dataverse in current environment.

get.description: Get all organizations.

post.summary: When a row is added, modified or deleted
post.description: This trigger allows you to start a flow when a row is added, modified or deleted in a Microsoft Dataverse table, such that it matches the selected options. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: Consistency
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse by pass the cache and hit DB

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Using this header parameter to save catalog in flow definition and Microsoft Dataverse will ignore as they don't use this info

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Using this header parameter to save category in flow definition and Microsoft Dataverse will ignore as they don't use this info

get.summary: List rows
get.description: This action allows you to list the rows in a Microsoft Dataverse table that match the selected options. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: prefer
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse return the created resource

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse return the odata id

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Enter a comma-separated list of column unique names to limit which columns are listed

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Enter an OData style filter expression to limit which rows are listed

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Columns to sort by in OData orderBy style (excluding lookups)

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Enter an Odata style expand query to list related rows

parameters.name: fetchXml
parameters.description: Enter a Fetch XML query for advanced customization

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Enter the number of rows to be listed (default = 5000)

parameters.name: $skiptoken
parameters.description: Enter the skip token obtained from a previous run to list rows from the next page

parameters.name: partitionId
parameters.description: An option to specify the partitionId while retrieving data for NoSQL tables

post.description: This action allows you to add a new row in the selected Microsoft Dataverse table. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: prefer
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse return the created resource

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse return the odata id

get.summary: Get a row by ID
get.description: This action allows you to get the row that matches an ID in a Microsoft Dataverse table. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: prefer
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse return the created resource

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse return the odata id

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Enter a comma-separated list of column unique names to limit which columns are listed

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Enter an Odata style expand query to list related rows

parameters.name: partitionId
parameters.description: An option to specify the partitionId while retrieving data for NoSQL tables

delete.description: This action allows you to delete a row from a Microsoft Dataverse table. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: partitionId
parameters.description: An option to specify the partitionId while deleting row for NoSQL tables

parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse return the odata id

post.description: Predict

parameters.name: modelId
parameters.description: Choose an option or add your own

get.summary: Get schema for predict operation
get.description: Gets operation schema for predict operation.

post.description: This action allows you to use the AI Builder models in your Microsoft Dataverse environment for predictions. Common models include Form Processing, Object Detection, Text Classification or use the prebuilt Business Card Reader, Key phrase extraction, Language detection, Text recognition � OCR and Sentiment Analysis.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The header required to allow Dataverse to process the request async with 202 OK and location headers

post.summary: Add to feedback loop of AI Builder models (Preview)
post.description: [Preview] This action allows you to add feedback loop items to AI Builder models in your Microsoft Dataverse environment.

inputName.description: Name used for the prediction input

post.description: Use AI Builder models with a Microsoft Dataverse row Id. With the predict action you can use your custom AI Builder Models of Form Processing, Object Detection, Text Classification or use the prebuilt Business Card Reader, Key phrase extraction, Language detection, Text recognition � OCR and Sentiment Analysis.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Choose an option or add your own

post.description: This action allows you to link a row in one Microsoft Dataverse table to another if the tables have a one-to-many or many-to-many relationship. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

delete.description: This action allows you to remove the link between a row in one Microsoft Dataverse table to another if the tables have a one-to-many or many-to-many relationship. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: $id
parameters.description: Enter the row URL using OData ID from a previous step or typing the full URL (eg. https://org0.crm.dynamics.com/api/data/v9.0/faxes(3ce6c728-3c8a-4b55-a4ee-a251b253c3ee)

post.description: Associate individual rows in tables that have a one-to-many or many-to-many relationship in the same Power Platform environment.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

delete.description: Remove the association between individual rows in a Power Platform environment.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: $id
parameters.description: Enter the row URL using OData ID from a previous step or typing the full URL (eg. https://org0.crm.dynamics.com/api/data/v9.0/faxes(3ce6c728-3c8a-4b55-a4ee-a251b253c3ee)

post.description: Returns list of unbound actions based on environment

post.summary: Get bound actions based on environment
post.description: Returns list of bound actions based on environment

This action allows you to perform Microsoft Dataverse actions available in the environment that are not associated with any table. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).
Run a global Dataverse action in a Power Platform environment, including custom actions.
This action allows you to perform Microsoft Dataverse actions associated with a selected table. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

post.description: Run a Dataverse action bound to a table in a Power Platform environment, including custom actions.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

post.description: This action allows you to perform a group of Microsoft Dataverse connector operations as a single transaction. If one of the operations fails, all the successful actions are rolled back. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

put.summary: Upload a file or an image
put.description: This action allows you to upload a file or an image content to a Microsoft Dataverse table with a compatible column type. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: The header describing the content type

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: x-ms-file-name
parameters.description: Enter a name for the file or image

put.summary: Upload a file or an image (Preview)
put.description: Update file or image content in a row in a Power Platform environment.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: The header describing the content type

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: x-ms-file-name
parameters.description: Enter a name for the file or image

get.summary: Download a file or an image
get.description: This action allows you to download a file or an image content from a Microsoft Dataverse table. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse support chunked downloads

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Enter 'full' for entire image if enabled (default = thumbnail)

schema.description: The content of the file or image

get.summary: Download a file or an image (Preview)
get.description: Retrieve file or image data from a row in a Power Platform environment.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse support chunked downloads

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Enter the row's globally unique identifier (GUID)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Enter 'full' for entire image if enabled (default = thumbnail)

schema.description: The content of the file or image

get.summary: When a flow step is run from a business process flow
get.description: This trigger allows you to start a flow when the Run Flow button in a business process flow step is clicked. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

post.description: This action allows you to search a Microsoft Dataverse environment using Relevance Search, and returns the rows that match the search term most closely. This connector was formerly known as Common Data Service (current environment).

x-ms-notification-content.description: A schema for a webhook payload posted by the external services to the notification URL.

post.description: This Power Automate action allows you to perform Microsoft Dataverse operations in the background using Custom APIs that are not classified as functions. The list of APIs listed in the dropdown menu are only compatible APIs with this action.

parameters.name: Consistency
parameters.description: The header parameter required to make Microsoft Dataverse bypass the cache and hit DB.

parameters.name: x-ms-dyn-callback-url
parameters.description: The header parameter required to send callback url.
Choose a catalog to filter tables and actions.

parameters.description: Choose a category to filter tables and actions.

entityName
parameters.description: Choose a table to filter actions.

get.summary: Get async actions
get.description: Get all async actions.

DisplayCollectionName.description: Represents collection of table display names.

UserLocalizedLabel.description: The user localized display name label object.

EntitiesDynamicValuesList.description: List of tables as dynamic values.

value.description: List of tables as dynamic values.

EntitiesDynamicValuesListItem.description: Represents a table as dynamic value item.

LogicalName.description: The logical name of the table.

DisplayCollectionName.description: The display name of the table.

@odata.nextLink.description: The url to fetch next page data.

OrganizationsDynamicValuesList.description: List of organizations as dynamic values.

value.description: List of organizations as dynamic values.

OrganizationsDynamicValuesListItem.description: Represents a table as dynamic value item.

url.description: Callback url to the flow engine. Expected as part of the request and provided by Flow.

name.description: Callback registration name. Value will be replaced with workflow id

sdkmessagename.description: Choose an option or add your own

scope.description: Choose a scope to limit which rows can trigger the flow

filteringattributes.description: Enter a comma-separated list of column unique names. The flow triggers if any of them are modified

filterexpression.description: Odata expression to limit rows that can trigger the flow, eg. statecode eq 0

postponeuntil.description: Enter a time to delay the trigger evaluation, eg. 2020-01-01T10:10:00Z

runas.description: Choose the running user for steps where invoker connections are used

Label.description: The display name label of the table.

EntityRelationshipsDynamicValuesList.description: List of table relationship as dynamic values.

value.description: List of table relationships as dynamic values.

@odata.id.description: Enter the row URL using OData ID from a previous step or typing the full URL (eg. https://org0.crm.dynamics.com/api/data/v9.0/faxes(3ce6c728-3c8a-4b55-a4ee-a251b253c3ee)

ActionsDynamicValuesList.description: List of actions as dynamic values

value.description: List of actions as dynamic values

BPFInstanceEntityName.description: Business process flow instance table name

BPFDefinitionEntityName.description: Business process flow definition table name

BPFFlowStageLocalizedName.description: Business process flow stage localized name

BPFFlowStageEntityName.description: Business process flow stage table name

BPFFlowStageEntityCollectionName.x-ms-summary: BPF Flow Stage Table Collection Name
BPFFlowStageEntityCollectionName.description: Business process flow stage table collection name

BPFFlowStageEntityRecordId.x-ms-summary: BPF Flow Stage Table Row Id
BPFFlowStageEntityRecordId.description: Business process flow stage table row id

BPFActiveStageId.description: Business process flow active stage id

BPFActiveStageEntityName.description: Business process flow active stage table name

BPFActiveStageLocalizedName.description: Business process flow active stage localized name

search.description: Enter a search term, eg. Contoso. Searches modifiers like boolean operators, wildcards, fuzzy search, proximity search etc. require the search type full

searchtype.description: Enter whether simple or full search syntax should be used (default is simple)

searchmode.description: Enter whether any or all of the search terms must be matched (default is any)

top.description: Enter the number of search results to be listed (default = 50)

filter.description: Enter an Odata style filter expression to narrow the search

entities.description: Enter a comma-separated list of tables to be searched (default is all tables)

items.description: Enter a table unique name to be searched (default is all tables)

orderby.description: Enter a comma-separated list of column unique names followed by asc or desc

items.description: Enter a column unique name followed by asc or desc

facets.description: Enter a comma-separated list of facet queries to narrow the search

items.description: Enter a facet query to narrow the search

skip.description: Enter the number of search results to be skipped

totalrecordcount.description: Total count of results (-1 if returntotalrecordcount is set to false)

WhenAnActionIsPerformedSubscriptionReque.description: The callback registration table for when an action is performed trigger.

url.description: Callback url to the flow engine. Expected as part of the request and provided by Flow.

name.description: Callback registration name. Value will be replaced with workflow id.

scope.description: Choose a scope to limit which rows can trigger the flow.

entityname.description: Choose a table to filter actions.

PerformBackgroundOperationNotificationBo.description: Get the metadata for bound or unbound action inputs.

WebhookNotificationContentForPerformBack.description: The action response object which includes background operation state code and status code.
